intro: Leptotaenia filicina, commonly known as the slender liverwort, is a small, non-vascular plant belonging to the family Pottiaceae. It is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or rocky crevices. The plant has a thalloid structure, consisting of a flat, ribbon-like body that is often covered in a layer of fine, delicate hairs. Its reproductive structures, including male and female gametophytes, are located on the thallus surface. Leptotaenia filicina plays a role in soil stabilization and provides habitat for microorganisms in its ecological niche.
